list.name: Default
list.comment: Started inventory system, with starting items depending on chosen starting class. Inventory is drawn on screen.

task.summary:
Refactored Monster class to be a base class, created first child class Rat. Created a monster creator which uses sets of monsters based on the dungeon level to create randomized monsters for each floor based on that floor's difficulty.
Changed monsters so they can't go through walls.
TODO: Implement monsters range so they only pursue the player within their own given range.

Refactored Monster class to be a base class, created first child class Rat. Created a monster creator which uses sets of monsters based on the dungeon level to create randomized monsters for each floor based on that floor's difficulty.
Changed monsters so they can't go through walls.
TODO: Implement monsters range so they only pursue the player within their own given range.

Refactored Monster class to be a base class, created first child class Rat. Created a monster creator which uses sets of monsters based on the dungeon level to create randomized monsters for each floor based on that floor's difficulty.
Changed monsters so they can't go through walls.
TODO: Implement monsters range so they only pursue the player within their own given range.

Refactored Monster class to be a base class, created first child class Rat. Created a monster creator which uses sets of monsters based on the dungeon level to create randomized monsters for each floor based on that floor's difficulty.
Changed monsters so they can't go through walls.
TODO: Implement monsters range so they only pursue the player within their own given range.

Refactored Monster class to be a base class, created first child class Rat. Created a monster creator which uses sets of monsters based on the dungeon level to create randomized monsters for each floor based on that floor's difficulty.
Changed monsters so they can't go through walls.
TODO: Implement monsters range so they only pursue the player within their own given range.
Rebuilt Jar to reflect changes in monster hierarchy and monster AI
Rebuilt Jar to reflect changes in monster hierarchy and monster AI
Implemented monster only pursuing within a range, still buggy.
Implemented a vision_range var to keep track of how far the player can see, i.e. how much of the map is drawn at any given time.

MESSAGE.value:
Refactored Monster class to be a base class, created first child class Rat. Created a monster creator which uses sets of monsters based on the dungeon level to create randomized monsters for each floor based on that floor's difficulty.
Changed monsters so they can't go through walls.
TODO: Implement monsters range so they only pursue the player within their own given range.
Rebuilt Jar to reflect changes in monster hierarchy and monster AI
Implemented monster only pursuing within a range, still buggy.
Implemented a vision_range var to keep track of how far the player can see, i.e. how much of the map is drawn at any given time.
Added Javadocs and comments all over, changed some var names in dungeonBuilder that were odd. Made code generally more readable. Added backing color to Monsters and the Player.
Started inventory system, with starting items depending on chosen starting class. Inventory is drawn on screen.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Started inventory system, with starting items depending on chosen starting class. Inventory is drawn on screen.
